fns.name: cy.add
fns.descr: Add elements to the graph and return them.

formats.descr: Add a specified element to the graph.

args.name: eleObj
args.descr: A plain object that specifies the element.

formats.descr: Add the specified elements to the graph.

args.name: eleObjs
args.descr: An array of elements specified by plain objects.

formats.descr: Add the specified elements to the graph.

args.name: eles
args.descr: A collection of elements.

fns.name: cy.remove
fns.descr: Remove elements from the graph and return them.

formats.descr: Remove the specified elements.

args.name: eles
args.descr: A collection of elements to remove.

formats.descr: Remove elements in the graph matching the specified selector.

args.name: selector
args.descr: Elements matching this selector are removed.

fns.name: cy.load
fns.descr: Empty the graph, add the specified elements, and reapply the initialisation layout.

args.name: eleObjs
args.descr: An array of plain objects that specify the elements to load.

args.name: load
args.descr: A callback function called when the graph has loaded.

args.name: done
args.descr: A callback function called after the graph is loaded and just after the layout finishes.

fns.name: cy.collection
fns.descr: Return a new collection.

formats.descr: Get an empty collection.
Get a collection from elements in the graph matching the specified selector.

args.name: selector
args.descr: Elements matching this selector are in the returned collection.

formats.descr: Get a collection from an array of elements.

args.name: elesArray
args.descr: The elements in this array are in the returned collection.

fns.name: cy.getElementById
fns.descr: Get an element from its ID in a very performant way.

args.name: id
args.descr: The ID of the element to get.

fns.name: cy.$
fns.descr: Get elements in the graph matching a selector or a filter function.

formats.name: cy.$
formats.descr: Get elements in the graph matching the specified selector.

args.name: selector
args.descr: The selector the elements should match.

formats.name: cy.elements
formats.descr: Get elements in the graph matching the specified selector.

args.name: selector
args.descr: The selector the elements should match.

formats.name: cy.nodes
formats.descr: Get nodes in the graph matching the specified selector.

args.name: selector
args.descr: The selector the nodes should match.

formats.name: cy.edges
formats.descr: Get edges in the graph matching the specified selector.

args.name: selector
args.descr: The selector the edges should match.

formats.name: cy.filter
formats.descr: Get elements in the graph matching the specified selector.

args.name: selector
args.descr: The selector the elements should match.

formats.name: cy.filter
formats.descr: Get elements in the graph matching the specified filter function.

args.name: function(i, ele)
args.descr: The filter function that returns true for elements that should be returned.

fields.name: i
fields.descr: The counter used for iteration over the elements in the graph.

fields.name: ele
fields.descr: The current element under consideration for filtering (also accessible as `this`).

fns.name: cy.batch
fns.descr: Allow for manipulation of elements without triggering multiple style calculations or multiple redraws.

args.name: function()
args.descr: A callback within which you can make batch updates to elements.

formats.name: cy.startBatch
formats.descr: Starts batching manually (useful for asynchronous cases).

formats.name: cy.endBatch
formats.descr: Ends batching manually (useful for asynchronous cases).

fns.name: cy.destroy
fns.descr: A convenience function to explicitly destroy the instance.

fns.name: cy.on
fns.descr: Bind to events that occur in the graph.

args.name: events
args.descr: A space separated list of event names.

args.name: selector
args.descr: A selector to specify elements for which the handler is triggered.

args.name: data
args.descr: A plain object which is passed to the handler in the event object argument.

args.name: function(evt)
args.descr: The handler function that is called when one of the specified events occurs.

fields.name: evt
fields.descr: The event object.

args.name: eventsMap
args.descr: A map of event names to handler functions.

args.name: selector
args.descr: A selector to specify elements for which the handler is triggered.

args.name: data
args.descr: A plain object which is passed to the handler in the event object argument.

fns.name: cy.one
fns.descr: Bind to events that occur in the graph, and trigger the handler only once.

args.name: events
args.descr: A space separated list of event names.

args.name: selector
args.descr: A selector to specify elements for which the handler is triggered.

args.name: data
args.descr: A plain object which is passed to the handler in the event object argument.

args.name: function(evt)
args.descr: The handler function that is called when one of the specified events occurs.

fields.name: evt
fields.descr: The event object.

args.name: eventsMap
args.descr: A map of event names to handler functions.

args.name: selector
args.descr: A selector to specify elements for which the handler is triggered.

args.name: data
args.descr: A plain object which is passed to the handler in the event object argument.

fns.name: cy.off
fns.descr: Remove event handlers.

args.name: events
args.descr: A space separated list of event names.

args.name: selector
args.descr: The same selector used to bind to the events.

args.name: handler
args.descr: A reference to the handler function to remove.

args.name: eventsMap
args.descr: A map of event names to handler functions to remove.

args.name: selector
args.descr: The same selector used to bind to the events.

fns.name: cy.trigger
fns.descr: Trigger one or more events.

args.name: events
args.descr: A space separated list of event names to trigger.

args.name: extraParams
args.descr: An array of additional parameters to pass to the handler.

fns.name: cy.initrender
fns.descr: Get whether the initial render event has occurred (useful for plugins etc).

fns.name: cy.ready
fns.descr: Run a callback as soon as the graph becomes ready.  If the graph is already ready, then the callback is called immediately.

args.name: function()
args.descr: The callback run as soon as the graph is ready, inside which `this` refers to the core (`cy`).

fns.name: cy.initrender
fns.descr: Get whether the initial render event has occurred (useful for plugins etc).

fns.name: cy.center
fns.descr: Pan the graph to the centre of a collection.

formats.descr: Centre on all elements in the graph.
Centre on the specified elements.

args.name: eles
args.descr: The collection to centre upon.

fns.name: cy.fit
fns.descr: Pan and zooms the graph to fit to a collection.

formats.descr: Fit to all elements in the graph.
Fit to the specified elements.

args.name: eles
args.descr: The collection to fit to.

args.name: padding
args.descr: An amount of padding (in pixels) to have around the graph

fns.name: cy.reset
fns.descr: Reset the graph to the default zoom level and panning position.

formats.descr: Resets the zoom and pan.

fns.name: cy.pan
fns.descr: Get or set the panning position of the graph.

formats.descr: Get the current panning position.
Set the current panning position.

args.name: renderedPosition
args.descr: The rendered position to pan the graph to.

fns.name: cy.panBy
fns.descr: Relatively pan the graph by a specified rendered position vector.

args.name: renderedPosition
args.descr: The rendered position vector to pan the graph by.

fns.name: cy.panningEnabled
fns.descr: Get or set whether panning is enabled.  If `cy.boxSelectionEnabled() === true`, then the user must taphold to initiate panning.

formats.descr: Get whether panning is enabled.
Set whether panning is enabled.

args.name: bool
args.descr: A truthy value enables panning; a falsey value disables it.

fns.name: cy.userPanningEnabled
fns.descr: Get or set whether panning by user events (e.g. dragging the graph background) is enabled.  If `cy.boxSelectionEnabled() === true`, then the user must taphold to initiate panning.

formats.descr: Get whether user panning is enabled.
Set whether user panning is enabled.

args.name: bool
args.descr: A truthy value enables user panning; a falsey value disables it.

fns.name: cy.zoom
fns.descr: Get or set the zoom level of the graph.

formats.descr: Get the zoom level.
Set the zoom level.

args.name: level
args.descr: The zoom level to set.

formats.descr: Set the zoom level.

args.name: options
args.descr: The options for zooming.

fields.name: level
fields.descr: The zoom level to set.

fields.name: position
fields.descr: The position about which to zoom.

fields.name: renderedPosition
fields.descr: The rendered position about which to zoom.

fns.name: cy.zoomingEnabled
fns.descr: Get or set whether zooming is enabled.

formats.descr: Get whether zooming is enabled.
Set whether zooming is enabled.

args.name: bool
args.descr: A truthy value enables zooming; a falsey value disables it.

fns.name: cy.userZoomingEnabled
fns.descr: Get or set whether zooming by user events (e.g. mouse wheel, pinch-to-zoom) is enabled.

formats.descr: Get whether user zooming is enabled.
Set whether user zooming is enabled.

args.name: bool
args.descr: A truthy value enables user zooming; a falsey value disables it.

fns.name: cy.minZoom
fns.descr: Get or set the minimum zoom level.

formats.descr: Get the minimum zoom level.
Set the minimum zoom level.

args.name: zoom
args.descr: The new minimum zoom level to use.

fns.name: cy.maxZoom
fns.descr: Get or set the maximum zoom level.

formats.descr: Get the maximum zoom level.
Set the maximum zoom level.

args.name: zoom
args.descr: The new maximum zoom level to use.

fns.name: cy.viewport
fns.descr: Set the viewport state (pan & zoom) in one call.

args.name: zoom
args.descr: The zoom level to set.

args.name: pan
args.descr: The pan to set (a rendered position).

fns.name: cy.boxSelectionEnabled
fns.descr: Get or set whether box selection is enabled.   If enabled, the user must hold left-click to initiate panning.

formats.descr: Get whether box selection is enabled.
Set whether box selection is enabled.

args.name: bool
args.descr: A truthy value enables box selection; a falsey value disables it.

fns.name: cy.width
fns.descr: Get the on-screen width of the viewport in pixels.

fns.name: cy.height
fns.descr: Get the on-screen height of the viewport in pixels.

fns.name: cy.extent
fns.descr: Get the extent of the viewport, a bounding box in model coordinates that lets you know what model positions are visible in the viewport.

fns.name: cy.autolock
fns.descr: Get or set whether nodes are automatically locked (i.e. if `true`, nodes are locked despite their individual state).

formats.descr: Get whether autolocking is enabled.
Set whether autolocking is enabled.

args.name: bool
args.descr: A truthy value enables autolocking; a falsey value disables it.

fns.name: cy.autoungrabify
fns.descr: Get or set whether nodes are automatically ungrabified (i.e. if `true`, nodes are ungrabbale despite their individual state).

formats.descr: Get whether autoungrabifying is enabled.
Set whether autoungrabifying is enabled.

args.name: bool
args.descr: A truthy value enables autoungrabbifying; a falsey value disables it.

fns.name: cy.autounselectify
fns.descr: Get or set whether nodes are automatically unselectified (i.e. if `true`, nodes are unselectable despite their individual state).

formats.descr: Get whether autounselectifying is enabled.
Set whether autounselectifying is enabled.

args.name: bool
args.descr: A truthy value enables autounselectifying; a falsey value disables it.

fns.name: cy.forceRender
fns.descr: Force the renderer to redraw (i.e. draw a new frame).

fns.name: cy.resize
fns.descr: Force the renderer to recalculate the viewport bounds.

fns.name: cy.animated
fns.descr: Get whether the viewport is currently being animated.

fns.name: cy.animate
fns.descr: Animate the viewport.

args.name: props
args.descr: An object containing the properties to animate.

fields.name: zoom
fields.descr: A zoom level to which the graph will be animated.

fields.name: pan
fields.descr: A panning position to which the graph will be animated.

fields.name: panBy
fields.descr: A relative panning position to which the graph will be animated.

fields.name: fit
fields.descr: An object containing fitting options from which the graph will be animated.

fields.name: eles
fields.descr: Elements or a selector to which the viewport will be fitted.

fields.name: padding
fields.descr: Padding to use with the fitting.

fields.name: center
fields.descr: An object containing centring options from which the graph will be animated.

fields.name: eles
fields.descr: Elements or a selector to which the viewport will be centred.

args.name: options
args.descr: An object containing animation options.

fields.name: duration
fields.descr: The duration of the animation in milliseconds.

fields.name: queue
fields.descr: A boolean indicating whether to queue the animation.

fields.name: complete
fields.descr: A function to call when the animation is done.

fields.name: step
fields.descr: A function to call each time the animation steps.

fns.name: cy.delay
fns.descr: Add a delay between animations for the viewport.

args.name: duration
args.descr: How long the delay should be in milliseconds.

args.name: complete
args.descr: A function to call when the delay is complete.

fns.name: cy.stop
fns.descr: Stop all viewport animations that are currently running.

args.name: clearQueue
args.descr: A boolean, indicating whether the queue of animations should be emptied.

args.name: jumpToEnd
args.descr: A boolean, indicating whether the currently-running animations should jump to their ends rather than just stopping midway.

fns.name: cy.clearQueue
fns.descr: Remove all queued animations for the viewport.

fns.name: cy.layout
fns.descr: Run a layout, which algorithmically positions the nodes in the graph.

args.name: options
args.descr: The layout options.

fns.name: cy.makeLayout
fns.descr: Get a new layout, which can be used to algorithmically position the nodes in the graph.

args.name: options
args.descr: The layout options.

fns.name: cy.style
fns.descr: Get the entry point to modify the visual style of the graph after initialisation.

formats.descr: Get the current style object.
Assign a new stylesheet to replace the existing one.

args.name: stylesheet
args.descr: Either a `cytoscape.Stylesheet` object, a string stylesheet, or a JSON stylesheet (the same formats accepted for `options.style` at initialisation).

fns.name: cy.png
fns.descr: Export the current graph view as a PNG image in Base64 representation.

args.name: options
args.descr: The export options.

fields.name: bg
fields.descr: The background colour of the image (transparent by default).

fields.name: full
fields.descr: Whether to export the current viewport view (`false`, default) or the entire graph (`true`).

fields.name: scale
fields.descr: This value specifies a positive number that scales the size of the resultant image.

fns.name: cy.json
fns.descr: Export the graph as JSON, the same format used at initialisation.

fns.name: eles.remove
fns.descr: Remove the elements from the graph.

fns.name: ele.removed
fns.descr: Get whether the element has been removed from the graph.

fns.name: ele.inside
fns.descr: Get whether the element is inside the graph (i.e. not removed).

fns.name: eles.restore
fns.descr: Put removed elements back into the graph.

fns.name: eles.clone
fns.descr: Get a new collection containing clones (i.e. copies) of the elements in the calling collection.

fns.name: eles.move
fns.descr: Effectively move edges to different nodes or move nodes to different parent node.  The modified (actually new) elements are returned.

formats.name: edges.move
formats.descr: Move edges to different nodes.

args.name: location
args.descr: Where the edges are moved.  You can specify a new source, a new target, or both.

fields.name: source
fields.descr: The ID of the new source node.

fields.name: target
fields.descr: The ID of the new target node.

formats.name: nodes.move
formats.descr: Move nodes to different parent node.

args.name: location
args.descr: Where the nodes are moved.

fields.name: parent
fields.descr: The ID of the new parent node (use `null` for no parent).

fns.name: eles.on
fns.descr: Bind to events that occur on the elements.

args.name: events
args.descr: A space separated list of event names.

args.name: selector
args.descr: A delegate selector to specify child elements for which the handler is triggered.

args.name: data
args.descr: A plain object which is passed to the handler in the event object argument.

args.name: function(evt)
args.descr: The handler function that is called when one of the specified events occurs.

fields.name: evt
fields.descr: The event object.

args.name: eventsMap
args.descr: A map of event names to handler functions.

args.name: selector
args.descr: A delegate selector to specify child elements for which the handler is triggered.

args.name: data
args.descr: A plain object which is passed to the handler in the event object argument.

args.name: selector

args.name: data
args.descr: A plain object which is passed to the handler in the event object argument.

args.name: function(evt)

fields.name: evt

args.name: eventsMap
args.descr: A map of event names to handler functions.

args.name: selector
args.descr: A delegate selector to specify child elements for which the handler is triggered.

args.name: data
args.descr: A plain object which is passed to the handler in the event object argument.

fns.name: eles.once
fns.descr: Bind a callback function that is triggered once per event per collection.

args.name: events
args.descr: A space separated list of event names.

args.name: selector
args.descr: A delegate selector to specify child elements for which the handler is triggered.

args.name: data
args.descr: A plain object which is passed to the handler in the event object argument.

args.name: function(evt)
args.descr: The handler function that is called when one of the specified events occurs.

fields.name: evt
fields.descr: The event object.

args.name: eventsMap
args.descr: A map of event names to handler functions.

args.name: selector
args.descr: A delegate selector to specify child elements for which the handler is triggered.

args.name: data
args.descr: A plain object which is passed to the handler in the event object argument.

fns.name: eles.off
fns.descr: Unbind one or more callback functions on the elements.

args.name: events
args.descr: A space separated list of event names.

args.name: selector
args.descr: The same delegate selector used to bind to the events.

args.name: handler
args.descr: A reference to the handler function to remove.

args.name: eventsMap
args.descr: A map of event names to handler functions to remove.

args.name: selector
args.descr: The same delegate selector used to bind to the events.

fns.name: eles.trigger
fns.descr: Trigger events on the elements.

args.name: events
args.descr: A space separated list of event names to trigger.

args.name: extraParams
args.descr: An array of additional parameters to pass to the handler.

fns.name: eles.data
fns.descr: Read and write developer-defined data associated with the elements.

formats.name: ele.data
formats.descr: Get all data for the element.

formats.name: ele.data
formats.descr: Get a particular data field for the element.

args.name: name
args.descr: The name of the field to get.

formats.name: ele.data
formats.descr: Set a particular data field for the element.

args.name: name
args.descr: The name of the field to set.

args.name: value
args.descr: The value to set for the field.

formats.name: ele.data
formats.descr: Update multiple data fields at once via an object.

args.name: obj
args.descr: The object containing name-value pairs to update data fields.

fns.name: eles.removeData
fns.descr: Remove developer-defined data associated with the elements.

formats.descr: Removes all mutable data fields for the elements.
Removes the specified mutable data fields for the elements.

args.name: names
args.descr: A space-separated list of fields to delete.

fns.name: ele.scratch
fns.descr: Set or get scratchpad data, where temporary or non-JSON data can be stored.  App-level scratchpad data should use namespaces prefixed with underscore, like `'_foo'`.

formats.descr: Get the entire scratchpad object for the element.
Get the scratchpad at a particular namespace.

args.name: namespace
args.descr: A namespace string.

formats.descr: Set the scratchpad at a particular namespace.

args.name: namespace
args.descr: A namespace string.

args.name: value
args.descr: The value to set at the specified namespace.

fns.name: ele.removeScratch
fns.descr: Remove scratchpad data.  You should remove scratchpad data only at your own namespaces.

formats.descr: Remove the scratchpad data at a particular namespace.

args.name: namespace
args.descr: A namespace string.

fns.name: ele.id
fns.descr: A shortcut to get the ID of an element.

fns.name: ele.json
fns.descr: Get the element's plain JavaScript object representation.

fns.name: eles.jsons
fns.descr: Get an array of the plain JavaScript object representation of all elements in the collection.

fns.name: ele.group
fns.descr: Get the group string that defines the type of the element.

fns.name: ele.isNode
fns.descr: Get whether the element is a node.

fns.name: ele.isEdge
fns.descr: Get whether the element is an edge.

fns.name: edge.isLoop
fns.descr: Get whether the edge is a loop (i.e. source same as target).

fns.name: edge.isSimple
fns.descr: Get whether the edge is simple (i.e. source different than target).

formats.name: node.degree

args.descr: A boolean, indicating whether loops are to be included in degree calculations.

formats.name: node.indegree

args.name: includeLoops
args.descr: A boolean, indicating whether loops are to be included in degree calculations.

formats.name: node.outdegree
formats.descr: Get the outdegree of a node.

args.name: includeLoops
args.descr: A boolean, indicating whether loops are to be included in degree calculations.

formats.name: nodes.totalDegree
formats.descr: Get the total degree of a collection of nodes.

args.name: includeLoops
args.descr: A boolean, indicating whether loops are to be included in degree calculations.

formats.name: nodes.minDegree
formats.descr: Get the minimum degree of the nodes in the collection.

args.name: includeLoops
args.descr: A boolean, indicating whether loops are to be included in degree calculations.

formats.name: nodes.maxDegree
formats.descr: Get the maximum degree of the nodes in the collection.

args.name: includeLoops

formats.name: nodes.minIndegree

args.name: includeLoops

formats.name: nodes.maxIndegree
formats.descr: Get the maximum indegree of the nodes in the collection.

args.name: includeLoops

formats.name: nodes.minOutdegree
formats.descr: Get the minimum outdegree of the nodes in the collection.

args.name: includeLoops

formats.name: nodes.maxOutdegree
formats.descr: Get the maximum outdegree of the nodes in the collection.

args.name: includeLoops
args.descr: A boolean, indicating whether loops are to be included in degree calculations.

fns.name: node.position
fns.descr: Get or set the (model) position of a node.

formats.descr: Get the entire position object.
Get the value of a specified position dimension.

args.name: dimension
args.descr: The position dimension to get.

formats.descr: Set the value of a specified position dimension.

args.name: dimension
args.descr: The position dimension to set.

args.name: value
args.descr: The value to set to the dimension.

formats.descr: Set the position using name-value pairs in the specified object.

args.name: pos
args.descr: An object specifying name-value pairs representing dimensions to set.

fns.name: nodes.positions
fns.descr: Set the (model) positions of several nodes with a function.

formats.descr: Set the positions functionally.

args.name: function(i, ele)
args.descr: A callback function that returns the position to set for each element.

fields.name: i
fields.descr: The index of the element when iterating over the elements in the collection.

fields.name: ele
fields.descr: The element being iterated over for which the function should return a position to set.

formats.descr: Set positions for all nodes based on a single position object.

args.name: pos
args.descr: An object specifying name-value pairs representing dimensions to set.

fns.name: node.renderedPosition
fns.descr: Get or set the rendered (on-screen) position of a node.

formats.descr: Get the entire rendered position object.
Get the value of a specified rendered posisition dimension.

args.name: dimension
args.descr: The position dimension to get.

formats.descr: Set the value of a specified rendered posisition dimension.

args.name: dimension
args.descr: The position dimension to set.

args.name: value
args.descr: The value to set to the dimension.

formats.descr: Set the rendered position using name-value pairs in the specified object.

args.name: pos
args.descr: An object specifying name-value pairs representing dimensions to set.

fns.name: ele.width
fns.descr: Get the width of the element.

formats.name: ele.width
formats.descr: Get the width of the element.

formats.name: ele.outerWidth
formats.descr: Get the outer width of the element (includes width & border).

formats.name: ele.renderedWidth
formats.descr: Get the width of the element in rendered dimensions.

formats.name: ele.renderedOuterWidth
formats.descr: Get the outer width of the element (includes width & border) in rendered dimensions.

fns.name: ele.height
fns.descr: Get the height of the element.

formats.name: ele.height
formats.descr: Get the height of the element.

formats.name: ele.outerHeight
formats.descr: Get the outer height of the element (includes height & border).

formats.name: ele.renderedHeight
formats.descr: Get the height of the element in rendered dimensions.

formats.name: ele.renderedOuterHeight
formats.descr: Get the outer height of the element (includes height & border) in rendered dimensions.

fns.name: eles.boundingBox
fns.descr: Get the bounding box of the elements.

formats.name: eles.boundingBox
formats.descr: Get the bounding box of the elements in model coordinates.

args.name: options
args.descr: An object containing options for the function.

fields.name: includeNodes
fields.descr: A boolean indicating whether to include nodes in the bounding box.

fields.name: includeEdges
fields.descr: A boolean indicating whether to include edges in the bounding box.

fields.name: includeLabels
fields.descr: A boolean indicating whether to include labels in the bounding box.

formats.name: eles.renderedBoundingBox
formats.descr: Get the bounding box of the elements in rendered coordinates.

args.name: options
args.descr: An object containing options for the function.

fields.name: includeNodes
fields.descr: A boolean indicating whether to include nodes in the bounding box.

fields.name: includeEdges
fields.descr: A boolean indicating whether to include edges in the bounding box.

fields.name: includeLabels
fields.descr: A boolean indicating whether to include labels in the bounding box.

fns.name: node.grabbed
fns.descr: Get whether a node is currently grabbed, meaning the user has hold of the node.

fns.name: node.grabbable
fns.descr: Get whether the user can grab a node.

fns.name: nodes.grabify
fns.descr: Allow the user to grab the nodes.

fns.name: nodes.ungrabify
fns.descr: Disallow the user to grab the nodes.

fns.name: node.locked
fns.descr: Get whether a node is locked, meaning that its position can not be changed.

fns.name: nodes.lock
fns.descr: Lock the nodes such that their positions can not be changed.

fns.name: nodes.unlock
fns.descr: Unlock the nodes such that their positions can be changed.

fns.name: ele.active
fns.descr: Gets whether the element is active (e.g. on user tap, grab, etc).

fns.name: eles.layout
fns.descr: Run a layout on the elements in the calling collection, algorithmically positioning the nodes.

args.name: options
args.descr: The layout options.

fns.name: eles.makeLayout
fns.descr: Get a new layout, which can be used to algorithmically position the nodes in the collection.

args.name: options
args.descr: The layout options.

fns.name: ele.selected
fns.descr: Get whether the element is selected.

fns.name: eles.select
fns.descr: Make the elements selected (NB other elements outside the collection are not affected).

fns.name: eles.unselect
fns.descr: Make the elements not selected (NB other elements outside the collection are not affected).

fns.name: ele.selectable
fns.descr: Get whether the element's selection state is mutable.

fns.name: eles.selectify
fns.descr: Make the selection states of the elements mutable.

fns.name: eles.unselectify
fns.descr: Make the selection states of the elements immutable.

fns.name: eles.addClass
fns.descr: Add classes to elements.

args.name: classes
args.descr: A space-separated list of class names to add to the elements.

fns.name: eles.removeClass
fns.descr: Remove classes from elements.

args.name: classes
args.descr: A space-separated list of class names to remove from the elements.

fns.name: eles.toggleClass
fns.descr: Toggle whether the elements have the specified classes.

args.name: classes
args.descr: A space-separated list of class names to toggle on the elements.

args.name: toggle
args.descr: Instead of automatically toggling, adds the classes on truthy values or removes them on falsey values.

fns.name: eles.flashClass
fns.descr: Add classes to the elements, and then remove the classes after a specified duration.

args.name: classes
args.descr: A space-separated list of class names to flash on the elements.

args.name: duration
args.descr: The duration in milliseconds that the classes should be added on the elements.  After the duration, the classes are removed.

fns.name: ele.hasClass
fns.descr: Get whether an element has a particular class.

args.name: className
args.descr: The name of the class to test for.

fns.name: eles.css
fns.descr: Get the style of the element, or override the style of the elements.

formats.name: ele.css
formats.descr: Get a name-value pair object containing visual style properties and their values for the element.

formats.name: ele.css
formats.descr: Get a particular style property value.

args.name: name
args.descr: The name of the visual style property to get.

formats.name: eles.css
formats.descr: Set the specified visual style property for the elements.

args.name: name
args.descr: The name of the property to set.

args.name: value
args.descr: The value to set to the visual style property.

formats.name: eles.css
formats.descr: Set several visual style properties at once for the elements.

args.name: props
args.descr: An object with name-value pairs representing properties to set on the elements.

fns.name: eles.removeCss
fns.descr: Removes overridden style of the elements.

formats.descr: Removes all overridden style of the elements.
Removes particular overridden style properties of the elements.

args.name: names
args.descr: A space-separated list of property names for which overridden styles will be removed.

fns.name: ele.renderedCss
fns.descr: Get the style of the element in rendered dimensions.

formats.descr: Get a name-value pair object containing rendered visual style properties and their values for the element.
Get a particular rendered style property value.

args.name: name
args.descr: The name of the visual style property to get.

fns.name: eles.show
fns.descr: Override the style of the elements such that they are visible (i.e. `display: element`).

fns.name: eles.hide
fns.descr: Override the style of the elements such that they are hidden (i.e. `display: none`).

fns.name: ele.visible
fns.descr: Get whether the element is visible (i.e. `display: element` and `visibility: visible`).

formats.name: ele.visible
formats.descr: Get whether the element is visible.

formats.name: ele.hidden
formats.descr: Get whether the element is hidden.

fns.name: ele.effectiveOpacity
fns.descr: Get the effective opacity of the element (i.e. on-screen opacity), which takes into consideration parent node opacity.

fns.name: ele.transparent
fns.descr: Get whether the element's effective opacity is completely transparent, which takes into consideration parent node opacity.

fns.name: ele.animated
fns.descr: Get whether the element is currently being animated.

fns.name: eles.animate
fns.descr: Animate the elements.

args.name: props
args.descr: An object containing the properties to animate.

fields.name: position
fields.descr: A position to which the elements will be animated.

fields.name: renderedPosition
fields.descr: A rendered position to which the elements will be animated.

fields.name: css
fields.descr: An object containing name-value pairs of style properties to animate.

args.name: options
args.descr: An object containing animation options.

fields.name: duration
fields.descr: The duration of the animation in milliseconds.

fields.name: queue
fields.descr: A boolean indicating whether to queue the animation.

fields.name: complete
fields.descr: A function to call when the animation is done.

fields.name: step
fields.descr: A function to call each time the animation steps.

fns.name: eles.delay
fns.descr: Add a delay between animations for the elements.

args.name: duration
args.descr: How long the delay should be in milliseconds.

args.name: complete
args.descr: A function to call when the delay is complete.

fns.name: eles.stop
fns.descr: Stop all animations that are currently running.

args.name: clearQueue
args.descr: A boolean, indicating whether the queue of animations should be emptied.

args.name: jumpToEnd
args.descr: A boolean, indicating whether the currently-running animations should jump to their ends rather than just stopping midway.

fns.name: eles.clearQueue
fns.descr: Remove all queued animations for the elements.

fns.name: eles.same
fns.descr: Determine whether this collection contains exactly the same elements as another collection.

args.name: eles
args.descr: The other elements to compare to.

fns.name: eles.anySame
fns.descr: Determine whether this collection contains any of the same elements as another collection.

args.name: eles
args.descr: The other elements to compare to.

fns.name: eles.allAreNeighbors
fns.descr: Determine whether all elements in the specified collection are in the neighbourhood of the calling collection.

args.name: eles
args.descr: The other elements to compare to.

fns.name: eles.is
fns.descr: Determine whether any element in this collection matches a selector.

args.name: selector
args.descr: The selector to match against.

fns.name: eles.allAre
fns.descr: Determine whether all elements in the collection match a selector.

args.name: selector
args.descr: The selector to match against.

fns.name: eles.some
fns.descr: Determine whether any element in this collection satisfies the specified test function.

args.name: function(ele, i, eles)
args.descr: The test function that returns truthy values for elements that satisfy the test and falsey values for elements that do not satisfy the test.

fields.name: ele
fields.descr: The current element.

fields.name: i
fields.descr: The index of the current element.

fields.name: eles
fields.descr: The collection of elements being tested.

args.name: thisArg
args.descr: The value for `this` within the test function.

fns.name: eles.every
fns.descr: Determine whether all elements in this collection satisfy the specified test function.

args.name: function(ele, i, eles)
args.descr: The test function that returns truthy values for elements that satisfy the test and falsey values for elements that do not satisfy the test.

fields.name: ele
fields.descr: The current element.

fields.name: i
fields.descr: The index of the current element.

fields.name: eles
fields.descr: The collection of elements being tested.

args.name: thisArg
args.descr: The value for `this` within the test function.

fns.name: eles.size
fns.descr: Get the number of elements in the collection.

fns.name: eles.empty
fns.descr: Get whether the collection is empty, meaning it has no elements.

formats.name: eles.empty
formats.descr: Get whether the collection is empty.

formats.name: eles.nonempty
formats.descr: Get whether the collection is nonempty.

fns.name: eles.each
fns.descr: Iterate over the elements in the collection.

args.name: function(i, ele)
args.descr: The function executed each iteration.

fields.name: i
fields.descr: The index of the element in the collection.

fields.name: ele
fields.descr: The element at the current index.

fns.name: eles.forEach
fns.descr: Iterate over the elements in the collection using an implementation like the native array function namesake.

args.name: function(ele, i, eles)
args.descr: The function executed each iteration.

fields.name: ele
fields.descr: The current element.

fields.name: i
fields.descr: The index of the current element.

fields.name: eles
fields.descr: The collection of elements being iterated.

args.name: thisArg
args.descr: The value for `this` within the iterating function.

fns.name: eles.eq
fns.descr: Get an element at a particular index in the collection.

args.name: index
args.descr: The index of the element to get.

formats.name: eles.first
formats.descr: Get the first element in the collection.

formats.name: eles.last
formats.descr: Get the last element in the collection.

fns.name: eles.slice
fns.descr: Get a subset of the elements in the collection based on specified indices.

args.name: start
args.descr: An integer that specifies where to start the selection.  The first element has an index of 0.  Use negative numbers to select from the end of an array.

args.name: end
args.descr: An integer that specifies where to end the selection. If omitted, all elements from the start position and to the end of the array will be selected. Use negative numbers to select from the end of an array.

fns.name: eles.add
fns.descr: Get a new collection, resulting from adding the collection with another one

args.name: eles
args.descr: The elements to add.

args.name: elesArray
args.descr: An array of elements to add.

args.name: selector
args.descr: Elements in the graph matching this selector are added.

fns.name: eles.not
fns.descr: Get a new collection, resulting from the collection without some specified elements.

args.name: eles
args.descr: The elements that will not be in the resultant collection.

args.name: selector
args.descr: Elements from the calling collection matching this selector will not be in the resultant collection.

fns.name: eles.intersect
fns.descr: Get the elements in both this collection and another specified collection.

args.name: eles
args.descr: The elements to intersect with.

args.name: selector
args.descr: A selector representing the elements to intersect with.  All elements in the graph matching the selector are used as the passed collection.

fns.name: eles.filter
fns.descr: Get a new collection containing elements that are accepted by the specified filter.

formats.name: eles.filter
formats.descr: Get the elements that match the specified selector.

args.name: selector
args.descr: The selector to match against.

formats.name: eles.filter
formats.descr: Get the elements that match the specified filter function.

args.name: function(i, ele)
args.descr: The filter function that returns true for elements to include.

fields.name: i
fields.descr: The index of the current element being considered.

fields.name: ele
fields.descr: The element being considered.

formats.name: eles.nodes
formats.descr: Get the nodes that match the specified selector.

args.name: selector
args.descr: The selector to match against.

formats.name: eles.edges
formats.descr: Get the edges that match the specified selector.

args.name: selector
args.descr: The selector to match against.

fns.name: eles.stdFilter
fns.descr: Get a new collection containing elements that are accepted by the specified filter, using an implementation like the standard array namesake.

args.name: function(ele, i, eles)
args.descr: The filter function that returns truthy values for elements to include and falsey values for elements to exclude.

fields.name: ele
fields.descr: The current element.

fields.name: i
fields.descr: The index of the current element.

fields.name: eles
fields.descr: The collection of elements being filtered.

args.name: thisArg
args.descr: The value for `this` within the iterating function.

fns.name: eles.sort
fns.descr: Get a new collection containing the elements sorted by the specified comparison function.

args.name: function(ele1, ele2)
args.descr: The sorting comparison function that returns a negative number for `ele1` before `ele2`, 0 for `ele1` same as `ele2`, or a positive number for `ele1` after `ele2`.

fns.name: eles.map
fns.descr: Get an array containing values mapped from the collection.

args.name: function(ele, i, eles)
args.descr: The function that returns the mapped value for each element.

fields.name: ele
fields.descr: The current element.

fields.name: i
fields.descr: The index of the current element.

fields.name: eles
fields.descr: The collection of elements being mapped.

args.name: thisArg
args.descr: The value for `this` within the iterating function.

fns.name: eles.min
fns.descr: Find a minimum value in a collection.

args.name: function(ele, i, eles)
args.descr: The function that returns the value to compare for each element.

fields.name: ele
fields.descr: The current element.

fields.name: i
fields.descr: The index of the current element.

fields.name: eles
fields.descr: The collection of elements being searched.

args.name: thisArg
args.descr: The value for `this` within the iterating function.

fns.name: eles.max
fns.descr: Find a maximum value and the corresponding element.

args.name: function(ele, i, eles)
args.descr: The function that returns the value to compare for each element.

fields.name: ele
fields.descr: The current element.

fields.name: i
fields.descr: The index of the current element.

fields.name: eles
fields.descr: The collection of elements being searched.

args.name: thisArg
args.descr: The value for `this` within the iterating function.

fns.name: eles.neighborhood
fns.descr: Get the neighbourhood of the elements.

formats.name: eles.neighborhood
formats.descr: Get the open neighbourhood of the elements.

args.name: selector
args.descr: An optional selector that is used to filter the resultant collection.

formats.name: eles.openNeighborhood
formats.descr: Get the open neighbourhood of the elements.

args.name: selector
args.descr: An optional selector that is used to filter the resultant collection.

formats.name: eles.closedNeighborhood
formats.descr: Get the closed neighbourhood of the elements.

args.name: selector
args.descr: An optional selector that is used to filter the resultant collection.

fns.name: nodes.edgesWith
fns.descr: Get the edges connecting the collection to another collection.  Direction of the edges does not matter.

args.name: eles
args.descr: The other collection.

args.name: selector
args.descr: The other collection, specified as a selector which is matched against all elements in the graph.

fns.name: nodes.edgesTo
fns.descr: Get the edges coming from the collection (i.e. the source) going to another collection (i.e. the target).

args.name: eles
args.descr: The other collection.

args.name: selector
args.descr: The other collection, specified as a selector which is matched against all elements in the graph.

fns.name: edges.connectedNodes
fns.descr: Get the nodes connected to the edges in the collection.

args.name: selector
args.descr: An optional selector that is used to filter the resultant collection.

fns.name: nodes.connectedEdges
fns.descr: Get the edges connected to the nodes in the collection.

args.name: selector
args.descr: An optional selector that is used to filter the resultant collection.

fns.name: edge.source
fns.descr: Get source node of this edge.

args.name: selector
args.descr: An optional selector that is used to filter the resultant collection.

fns.name: edges.sources
fns.descr: Get source nodes connected to the edges in the collection.

args.name: selector
args.descr: An optional selector that is used to filter the resultant collection.

fns.name: edge.target
fns.descr: Get target node of this edge.

args.name: selector
args.descr: An optional selector that is used to filter the resultant collection.

fns.name: edges.targets
fns.descr: Get target nodes connected to the edges in the collection.

args.name: selector
args.descr: An optional selector that is used to filter the resultant collection.

fns.name: edges.parallelEdges
fns.descr: Get edges parallel to those in the collection.

args.name: selector
args.descr: An optional selector that is used to filter the resultant collection.

fns.name: edges.codirectedEdges
fns.descr: Get edges codirected to those in the collection.

args.name: selector
args.descr: An optional selector that is used to filter the resultant collection.

fns.name: nodes.roots
fns.descr: From the set of calling nodes, get the nodes which are roots (i.e. no incoming edges, as in a directed acyclic graph).

args.name: selector
args.descr: An optional selector that is used to filter the resultant collection.

fns.name: nodes.leaves
fns.descr: From the set of calling nodes, get the nodes which are leaves (i.e. no outgoing edges, as in a directed acyclic graph).

args.name: selector
args.descr: An optional selector that is used to filter the resultant collection.

fns.name: nodes.outgoers
fns.descr: Get edges (and their targets) coming out of the nodes in the collection.

args.name: selector
args.descr: An optional selector that is used to filter the resultant collection.

fns.name: nodes.successors
fns.descr: Recursively get edges (and their targets) coming out of the nodes in the collection (i.e. the outgoers, the outgoers' outgoers, ...).

args.name: selector
args.descr: An optional selector that is used to filter the resultant collection.

fns.name: nodes.incomers
fns.descr: Get edges (and their sources) coming into the nodes in the collection.

args.name: selector
args.descr: An optional selector that is used to filter the resultant collection.

fns.name: nodes.predecessors
fns.descr: Recursively get edges (and their sources) coming into the nodes in the collection (i.e. the incomers, the incomers' incomers, ...).

args.name: selector
args.descr: An optional selector that is used to filter the resultant collection.

fns.name: eles.breadthFirstSearch
fns.descr: Perform a breadth-first search within the elements in the collection.

fields.name: roots
fields.descr: The root nodes (selector or collection) to start the search from.

fields.name: visit: function(i, depth)
fields.descr: A handler function that is called when a node is visited in the search.  The handler returns `true` when it finds the desired node, and it returns `false` to cancel the search.

fields.name: i
fields.descr: The index indicating this node is the ith visited node.

fields.name: depth
fields.descr: How many edge hops away this node is from the root nodes.

fields.name: directed
fields.descr: A boolean indicating whether the algorithm should only go along edges from source to target (default `false`).

args.name: roots
args.descr: The root nodes (selector or collection) to start the search from.

args.name: function(i, depth)
args.descr: A handler function that is called when a node is visited in the search.  The handler returns `true` when it finds the desired node, and it returns `false` to cancel the search.

fields.name: i
fields.descr: The index indicating this node is the ith visited node.

fields.name: depth
fields.descr: How many edge hops away this node is from the root nodes.

args.name: directed
args.descr: A boolean indicating whether the search should only go along edges from source to target (default `false`).

fns.name: eles.depthFirstSearch
fns.descr: Perform a depth-first search within the elements in the collection.

fields.name: roots
fields.descr: The root nodes (selector or collection) to start the search from.

fields.name: visit: function(i, depth)
fields.descr: A handler function that is called when a node is visited in the search.  The handler returns `true` when it finds the desired node, and it returns `false` to cancel the search.

fields.name: i
fields.descr: The index indicating this node is the ith visited node.

fields.name: depth
fields.descr: How many edge hops away this node is from the root nodes.

fields.name: directed
fields.descr: A boolean indicating whether the algorithm should only go along edges from source to target (default `false`).

args.name: roots
args.descr: The root nodes (selector or collection) to start the search from.

args.name: function(i, depth)
args.descr: A handler function that is called when a node is visited in the search.  The handler returns `true` when it finds the desired node, and it returns `false` to cancel the search.

fields.name: i
fields.descr: The index indicating this node is the ith visited node.

fields.name: depth
fields.descr: How many edge hops away this node is from the root nodes.

args.name: directed
args.descr: A boolean indicating whether the search should only go along edges from source to target (default `false`).

fns.name: eles.dijkstra
fns.descr: Perform Dijkstra's algorithm on the elements in the collection.  This finds the shortest paths to all other nodes in the collection from the root node.

fields.name: root
fields.descr: The root node (selector or collection) where the algorithm starts.

fields.name: weight: function(edge)
fields.descr: A function that returns the positive numeric weight for `this` edge.

fields.name: directed
fields.descr: A boolean indicating whether the algorithm should only go along edges from source to target (default `false`).

args.name: root
args.descr: The root node (selector or collection) where the algorithm starts.

args.name: function(edge)
args.descr: A function that returns the positive numeric weight for `this` edge.

args.name: directed
args.descr: A boolean indicating whether the algorithm should only go along edges from source to target (default `false`).

fns.name: eles.aStar
fns.descr: Perform the A* search algorithm on the elements in the collection. This finds the shortest path from the root node to the goal node.

fields.name: root
fields.descr: The root node (selector or collection) where the search starts.

fields.name: goal
fields.descr: The goal node (selector or collection) where the search ends.

fields.name: weight: function(edge)
fields.descr: A function that returns the positive numeric weight for `this` edge.

fields.name: heuristic: function(node)
fields.descr: A function that returns an estimation (cannot be overestimation) on the shortest distance  from the current (`this`) node to the goal.

fields.name: directed
fields.descr: A boolean indicating whether the algorithm should only go along edges from source to target (default `false`).

fns.name: eles.floydWarshall
fns.descr: Perform Floyd Warshall search algorithm on the elements in the collection. This finds the shortest path between all pairs of nodes.

fields.name: weight: function(edge)
fields.descr: A function that returns the positive numeric weight for `this` edge.

fields.name: directed
fields.descr: A boolean indicating whether the algorithm should only go along edges from source to target (default `false`).

fns.name: eles.bellmanFord
fns.descr: Perform Bellman-Ford search algorithm on the elements in the collection. This finds the shortest path from the starting node to all other nodes in the collection.

fields.name: root
fields.descr: The root node (selector or collection) where the search starts.

fields.name: weight: function(edge)
fields.descr: A function that returns the positive numeric weight for `this` edge.

fields.name: directed
fields.descr: A boolean indicating whether the algorithm should only go along edges from source to target (default `false`).

fns.name: eles.kruskal
fns.descr: Perform Kruskal's algorithm on the elements in the collection, returning the minimum spanning tree, assuming undirected edges.

args.name: function(edge)
args.descr: A function that returns the positive numeric weight for `this` edge.

fns.name: eles.kargerStein
fns.descr: Finds the minimum cut in a graph using the Karger-Stein algorithm. The optimal result is found with a high probability, but without guarantee.

fns.name: eles.pageRank
fns.descr: Rank the nodes in the collection using the Page Rank algorithm.

fields.name: dampingFactor
fields.descr: Numeric parameter for the algorithm.

fields.name: precision
fields.descr: Numeric parameter that represents the required precision.

fields.name: iterations
fields.descr: Maximum number of iterations to perform.

fns.name: node.isParent
fns.descr: Get whether the node is a compound parent (i.e. a node containing one or more child nodes)

fns.name: node.isChild
fns.descr: Get whether the node is a compound child (i.e. contained within a node)

fns.name: nodes.parent
fns.descr: Get the compound parent node of each node in the collection.

args.name: selector
args.descr: A selector used to filter the resultant collection.

fns.name: nodes.parents
fns.descr: Get all compound ancestor nodes (i.e. parents, parents' parents, etc.) of each node in the collection.

args.name: selector
args.descr: A selector used to filter the resultant collection.

fns.name: nodes.commonAncestors
fns.descr: Get all compound ancestors common to all the nodes in the collection, starting with the closest and getting progressively farther.

args.name: selector
args.descr: A selector used to filter the resultant collection.

fns.name: nodes.orphans
fns.descr: Get all orphan (i.e. has no compound parent) nodes in the calling collection.

args.name: selector
args.descr: A selector used to filter the resultant collection.

fns.name: nodes.nonorphans
fns.descr: Get all nonorphan (i.e. has a compound parent) nodes in the calling collection.

args.name: selector
args.descr: A selector used to filter the resultant collection.

fns.name: nodes.children
fns.descr: Get all compound child (i.e. direct descendant) nodes of each node in the collection.

args.name: selector
args.descr: A selector used to filter the resultant collection.

fns.name: nodes.descendants
fns.descr: Get all compound descendant (i.e. children, children's children, etc.) nodes of each node in the collection.

args.name: selector
args.descr: A selector used to filter the resultant collection.

fns.name: nodes.siblings
fns.descr: Get all sibling (i.e. same compound parent) nodes of each node in the collection.

args.name: selector
args.descr: A selector used to filter the resultant collection.

fns.name: layout.run
fns.descr: Start running the layout.

fns.name: layout.stop
fns.descr: Stop running the (asynchronous/discrete) layout.

fns.name: layout.on
fns.descr: Bind to events that are emitted by the layout.

args.name: events
args.descr: A space separated list of event names.

args.name: data
args.descr: A plain object which is passed to the handler in the event object argument.

args.name: function(evt)
args.descr: The handler function that is called when one of the specified events occurs.

fields.name: evt
fields.descr: The event object.

args.name: eventsMap
args.descr: A map of event names to handler functions.

args.name: data
args.descr: A plain object which is passed to the handler in the event object argument.

fns.name: layout.one
fns.descr: Bind to events that are emitted by the layout, and trigger the handler only once.

args.name: events
args.descr: A space separated list of event names.

args.name: data
args.descr: A plain object which is passed to the handler in the event object argument.

args.name: function(evt)
args.descr: The handler function that is called when one of the specified events occurs.

fields.name: evt
fields.descr: The event object.

args.name: eventsMap
args.descr: A map of event names to handler functions.

args.name: data
args.descr: A plain object which is passed to the handler in the event object argument.

fns.name: layout.off
fns.descr: Remove event handlers on the layout.

args.name: events
args.descr: A space separated list of event names.

args.name: handler
args.descr: A reference to the handler function to remove.

args.name: eventsMap
args.descr: A map of event names to handler functions to remove.

fns.name: layout.trigger
fns.descr: Trigger one or more events on the layout.

args.name: events
args.descr: A space separated list of event names to trigger.

args.name: extraParams
args.descr: An array of additional parameters to pass to the handler.

demo.name: A diagramme of the architecture of Cytoscape.js, made using Cytoscape.js

extensions.name: cerebralweb
extensions.descr: A plugin to enable fast and interactive visualisation of molecular interaction networks stratified based on subcellular localisation or other custom annotation.

extensions.name: edgehandles
extensions.descr: UI for connecting nodes with edges.

extensions.name: navigator
extensions.descr: A bird's eye view widget of the graph.

extensions.name: noderesize
extensions.descr: A plugin that creates a node resize control.

extensions.name: qtip
extensions.descr: A wrapper that lets you use qTips on graph elements or the graph background.

extensions.name: supportimages
extensions.descr: A plugin that enables support images on Cytoscape.js

extensions.name: toolbar
extensions.descr: A plugin for Cytoscape.js that allows a user to create a custom toolbar to add next to a Cytoscape core instance.
